title: Musical legacy of Africans in Spain - argument

content.question: Which of the following best summarizes the authors’ argument in the excerpt?

choices.label: The small size of Spain’s Black African population led to its history being largely forgotten, and little textual evidence of the population remains available today.
The large population of Black Africans in sixteenth- and seventeenth-century Spain left an enduring legacy that is widely celebrated by modern Spaniards.
The role of Black Africans in Spanish history has not been adequately recognized despite the significant historical presence of Africans in Spain.
Black Africans were largely omitted from Spanish literature despite the sizable population of Africans living in Spain in the sixteenth century.

content.answer: The role of Black Africans in Spanish history has not been adequately recognized despite the significant historical presence of Africans in Spain.

skill.text: 2.A: Identify and explain a source's claim(s), evidence, and reasoning.
